page.title: 03OLD BUILDING
page.content: Bradford Street has many Georgian, Medieval and Tudor houses. The Georgian houses are mainly double fronted and include several larger building such as the old Court Hotel which has retained its carriage arch. The plaster work varies.There are muted pastel colours with different Essex Pargetting designs. The Medieval and Tudor buildings provide interesting examples of timber framed houses originally occupied by weavers and merchants. The houses have different types of jetties and carved exposed beams, frequently of a grape and leaf design. In Jullian Court Road there is a house dated around 1600's with its original oak beams. Along Cressing Road there is an interesting thatched cottage with deep eaves and latticed windows.
